history.text: Hello!
Hey there! If you haven't seen Inception yet, you're doing yourself a disservice. It's great!
I have seen Inception! Leonardo DiCaprio is great
Yeah, definitely. He deserved his award finally. Gotta give it to Gordon-Levitt too. His acting was quite on point as well.
Yeah, they are both great. What was your favorite part
Honestly, it has to be the ending. It was so open-ended that I found myself thinking about it for a while and debating with friends about it. How about you? What was yours?
Same here, I had to think about it a lot. I liked the shoot-out scenes.
Yeah, same. I really enjoyed the snow mountain too. Reminds me a lot of home.
The snow mountain was modeled after UC San Diego's library actually
Oh really? That's interesting. Didn't know that.
Were there any parts you didn't like?
Not particularly. I enjoyed most of the parts in general. What was your favorite part?
I liked the shoot-out scenes, the special effects of the film were great.
Yeah, they really were. It was what I'd expect from Christopher Nolan.
Do you like sci-fi movies like Inception usually?
The soundtrack was great too, Hans Zimmer was fantastic.
I like sci-fi movies but I don't normally watch movies.
Yeah, Hans Zimmer is such a visionary. The moment I see him pop up on a Soundtrack I know it'll be great.
I don't regularly watch movies, but I occasionally do when I've got time. Big movies like Inception find their way in.
Same here, he also did the soundtrack for Blade Runner 2049
Ah! I have yet to see that, but heard good things about it.
What are your thoughts on the whole science side of things in Inception? You think the whole "dream-sharing" tech could become something of a reality in the future?
I feel like there would be massive disasters before the level of tech would be up there.
What do you think?
Almost definitely lol
It's bad enough people are having issues with reality, but when dealing with dreams.. who knows what could happen. I've seen and read enough sci-fi that I'm apprehensive about it.
But it could have positive ramifications I suppose as well.
Definitely, I need to have more positive thoughts on the future.
A healthy dose of skepticism is always good I say. Keeps you on your toes. It would be quite fascinating to be able to enter dream worlds like that I admit.
I imagine many wouldn't want to leave them as a major issue.
That is definitely true, most people would be addicted to that sort of dream technology
Like the main character
Yeah, exactly. It becomes their new "reality" and their whole sense of self disappears.
The whole tragedy with his wife committing suicide was pretty hard-hitting. I can only imagine the psychological damage that would cause to someone.

That sort of technology would be reserved for the ultra-rich now that I think about it
.
Yeah, the technology would be used as escapism from the pain of real life
Sadly..

But I think you're right about that. It would be a terrible idea though; our most wealthy also happen to be the most powerful, influential figures. How bad would it be if they suddenly became addicted to such tech?

uid2response.feedback: We both already saw the movie and both loved it. It was great.
